hints.label: def-graph-conserved-quantities-discrete-sym
hints.title: Graph-Theoretic Conserved Quantities
hints.content:
759: :label: def-graph-conserved-quantities-discrete-sym
760: 
761: A functional $Q : \mathcal{F}_t \to \mathbb{R}$ is **conserved** if:
762: 
763: $$
764: \mathbb{E}[Q(\mathcal{F}_{t+\Delta t}) \mid \mathcal{F}_t] = Q(\mathcal{F}_t)
765: $$
766: 
767: for all timesteps $t$.
768: 
769: **Examples of conserved graph quantities**:
770: 
771: 1. **Total episode count in a time slice**:
772: 
773:    $$
774:    N_{\text{alive}}(t) = |\mathcal{A}(t)| = |\{e \in \mathcal{E} : t^{\rm b}_e \leq t < t^{\rm d}_e\}|
775:    $$
776: 
777: 2. **Causal order**:
778: 
779:    $$
780:    \text{Order}(\mathcal{F}) = \{(e_i, e_j) : e_i \prec e_j\}
781:    $$
782: 
783:    The partial order $\prec$ is **monotonically increasing**: once $e_i \prec e_j$, this relation persists.
784: 
785: 3. **Total edge count** (CST + IG):
786: 
787:    $$
788:    E_{\text{total}}(t) = |E_{\text{CST}}| + |E_{\text{IG}}|
789:    $$

hints.content:
835: 
836: :::{prf:proof}
837: **CST edges**: Each cloning event creates one parent → child edge. Maximum cloning rate is $N$ events per timestep.
838: 
839: **IG edges**: Each cloning event creates a complete graph on the alive set $\mathcal{A}(t)$. Number of edges in a clique of size $N$ is $\binom{N}{2} = O(N^2)$.

hints.label: prop-noether-correspondence-discrete-sym
hints.title: Correspondence between Discrete Symmetries and Conserved Quantities
hints.content:
845: :label: prop-noether-correspondence-discrete-sym
846: 
847: Each discrete symmetry of the Fractal Set has a corresponding conserved or quasi-conserved quantity, in analogy with Noether's theorem for continuous symmetries.
848: 
849: | **Symmetry** | **Conserved Quantity** | **Justification** |
850: |--------------|------------------------|-------------------|
851: | Episode permutation $S_{|\mathcal{E}|}$ | Graph isomorphism class | {prf:ref}`thm-discrete-permutation-invariance-discrete-sym`: All graph functionals are invariant under relabeling |
852: | Translation $T_a$ | Center of mass of spatial embedding | {prf:ref}`thm-discrete-translation-equivariance-discrete-sym`: Translation equivariance implies $\mathbb{E}[\Phi_{\text{COM}}(\mathcal{F}_{t+\Delta t})] = \mathbb{E}[\Phi_{\text{COM}}(\mathcal{F}_t)] + a$ |
853: | Rotation $SO(d)$ | Angular momentum (if velocity included) | {prf:ref}`cor-discrete-rotational-equivariance-discrete-sym`: Rotational equivariance implies conservation of total angular momentum about the origin |
854: | Time-translation | Episode count per time slice | {prf:ref}`prop-episode-count-conservation-discrete-sym`: Exactly $N$ alive episodes at each timestep |
855: 
856: **Heuristic arguments**:
857: 
858: 1. **Translation**: Define the center of mass as $\Phi_{\text{COM}}(\mathcal{F}) = \frac{1}{|\mathcal{E}|} \sum_{e \in \mathcal{E}} \Phi(e)$. Translation equivariance of the dynamics ensures this quantity shifts by exactly $a$ under $T_a$, implying conservation of the center of mass in the comoving frame.
859: 
860: 2. **Rotation**: If velocity is included in the embedding, define total angular momentum as $L(\mathcal{F}) = \sum_{e \in \mathcal{E}} \Phi(e) \times v_e$. Rotational equivariance implies this quantity is conserved (up to dissipation from friction).
861: 
862: 3. **Time-translation**: The population regulation mechanism ({prf:ref}`prop-episode-count-conservation-discrete-sym`) ensures exactly $N$ episodes are alive at each time, a discrete analogue of probability conservation.

hints.label: unlabeled-remark-110
hints.title: Comparison to Continuous Conservation Laws
hints.content:
868: :class: note
869: 
870: **Chapter 9 (Continuous)** vs **This Chapter (Discrete)**:
871: 
872: | Quantity | Continuous (Ch 9) | Discrete (This Ch) |
873: |----------|-------------------|-------------------|
874: | Walker count | $N_{\text{alive}}(t) = N$ | $\|\mathcal{A}(t)\| = N$ |
875: | Total probability | $\int \mathcal{P}_t(d\mathcal{S}) = 1$ | $\sum_{e \in \mathcal{E}} P(e \text{ alive at } t) = 1$ |
876: | Angular momentum | $\langle L(t) \rangle = \langle L(0) \rangle e^{-\gamma t}$ | No direct analogue (velocity not in CST) |
877: | Energy | Non-conserved (dissipative) | Edge count grows (information accumulation) |
